                                    <items id="description">Details of organisation/location of the second choice preference of place of care.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0036">
                                    <items id="text">Preferred place of death location</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of the organisation/location of the preferred place of death.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0037">
                                    <items id="text">Preferred place of death (second choice) location</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of the organisation/location of the preferred place of death (second choice).</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                    <items id="text">Patient care priority</items>
                                    <items id="description">A narrative statement by the patient on their preferred priorities of care.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">In the UI, this should be represented as 'Considering the above priorities. what is most important to you? (optional)'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                    <items id="text">Care priority scale</items>
                                    <items id="description">Indication on a scale of 1 - 100 of where priority for care should be. 1 indicates absolute priority on sustaining life (even at the expense of comfort) and 100 indicates absolute priority on comfort (even at the expense of sustaining life).</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.cpr_decision_uk.v0</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="text">CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The advance recommendation as to whether cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be undertaken or not. This is generally referred to in UK clinical guidance as the CPR (Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation) decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Date of CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date at which the CPR decision was originally taken or last reviewed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The advance recommendation as to whether cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) should be attempted. In some cases a clear answer may not be available to the recording clinician.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="text">CPR attempts recommended adult or child</items>
                                    <items id="description">Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation is recommended for adult or child.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">CPR attempts not recommended adult or child.</items>
                                    <items id="description">Cardiopulmonary resuscitation is not recommended for adult or child.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="text">Patient awareness of decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">Is the patient aware of the CPR decision?</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="text">Patient not aware of CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The patient is not aware of the cardiopulmonary resuscitation decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                    <items id="text">Patient aware of CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The patient is aware of the cardiopulmonary resucitation decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="text">Date for review of CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date at which the CPR decision should be reviewed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                    <items id="text">Location of CPR documentation</items>
                                    <items id="description">The location of the original CPR document, either a text description or an electronic link.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="text">Informal carer awareness of decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">Is the informal carer, or carers, aware of the CPR decision?</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="text">Discussion with patient</items>
                                    <items id="description">Has resuscitation been discussed with  the patient?</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="text">Discussion with informal carer</items>
                                    <items id="description">Has resuscitation been discussed with  the patient's informal carer or carers?</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="text">Resuscitation discussed with informal carer</items>
                                    <items id="description">Resuscitation has been discussed with the patient's informal carer.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                    <items id="text">Resuscitation discussed with patient</items>
                                    <items id="description">Resuscitation has been discussed with the patient.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="text">CPR form completed</items>
                                    <items id="description">Has the physical CPR form been completed?</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="text">CPR form completed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The physical CPR form has been completed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                    <items id="text">CPR form not completed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The physical CPR form has not been completed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                    <items id="description">Other narrative comment pertinent to the CPR decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                    <items id="text">CPR decision status unknown</items>
                                    <items id="description">There is no clear information on the outcome of the CPR decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                    <items id="text">Resucitation not discussed with patient</items>
                                    <items id="description">Resuscitation has not been discussed with the patient.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                    <items id="text">Resuscitation not discussed with informal carer</items>
                                    <items id="description">Resuscitation has not been discussed with the patient's informal carer or carers.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                    <items id="text">Informal carer not aware of CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The informal carer is not aware of the do not attempt cardiopulmonary resuscitation clinical decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                    <items id="text">Informal carer aware of CPR decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">The informal carer is aware of the do not attempt cardiopulmonary resucitation decision.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                    <items id="text">For modified CPR child only</items>
                                    <items id="description">Modified CPR is recommended for child only.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                    <items id="text">Details for Modified CPR child only</items>
                                    <items id="description">Narrative description of modification where modified CPR for child only has been selected.</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">Legal proxy</items>
                                    <items id="description">Do they have a legal proxy (e.g. welfare attorney, person with parental responsibility) who can participate on their behalf in making the recommendations?</items>
                                </term_definitions>

                                </term_definitions>

                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">

                                    <items id="text">Involvement ReSPECT</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of involvement in making plan.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Involvement</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of involvement in making this plan.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">A Person has mental capacity</items>
                                    <items id="description">This person has the mental capacity to participate in making these recommendations. They have been fully involved in making this plan.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="text">B Person does not have mental capacity</items>
                                    <items id="description">This person does not have the mental capacity to participate in making these recommendations. This plan has been made in accordance with capacity law, including, where applicable, in consultation with their legal proxy, or where no proxy, with relevant family members/friends.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">C1 Person less than 18 or 16 with sufficient maturity</items>
                                    <items id="description">This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) / 16 (Scotland) and they have sufficient maturity and understanding to participate in making this plan.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="text">Reason for not selecting Options A or B or C</items>
                                    <items id="description">Description of reason for not selecting Options A, B or C or where C1 or C2 is selected without selecting C3.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Additional implementation guidance: in an electronic format, if someone selects D we could have a line coming up explaining that the only legal reasons for selecting D are:
1. if the physician thinks it would cause the patient physiological or psychological harm
2. if the patient lacks capacity, and it is not practicable or appropriate to contact those close to them.
If C1 or C2 has been selected without selecting C3, please document why involvement of those holding parental responsibility has not been possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="text">Location of record of discussion</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of location(s) of full documentation of conversations and decision-making process.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example in GP Records dated xx/xx/xxxx.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="text">C2 Person less than 18 or 16 without sufficient maturity</items>
                                    <items id="description">This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) / 16 (Scotland) and they do not have sufficient maturity and understanding to participate in this plan. Their views, where known, have been taken into account.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                    <items id="text">C3 Person less than 18 or 16 parental decision</items>
                                    <items id="description">This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) /16 (Scotland) and those holding parental responsibility have been fully involved in discussing and making this plan.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="text">Involvement in recommendations</items>
                                    <items id="description">The clinician(s) signing this plan is/are confirming that these recommendations have at least one of A, B or C or valid reason for not selecting A,B or C fully documented in clinical record.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="text">D No other option selected</items>
                                    <items id="description">No other option has been selected, and valid reason is stated below. Full explanation is documented in clinical record.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="text">Date recommendations made</items>
                                    <items id="description">Date when recommendations are made.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="text">Name and role of those involved in decision making</items>
                                    <items id="description">Name and role of those involved in decision making.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                    <items id="text">Link to record of discussion</items>
                                    <items id="description">Link to record of discussion if held in a remote location.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="text">Name and role of those involved in decision making</items>
                                    <items id="description">*</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>

                                                            <items id="text">Practitioner role</items>

                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                            <items id="text">Identifier</items>

                                                        </term_definitions>

                                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                            <items id="text">Practitioner</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organisation.</items>

                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0009">

                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">

                                                        </term_definitions>

                                                            <items id="text">Telecom</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Contact details that are specific to the role/location/service.</items>

                                                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                            <items id="text">Prefix</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                            <items id="text">Suffix</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>

                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Signing clinician</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Practitioner details aligned with FHIR resource.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                    <items id="text">Active</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                                    <items id="text">Name</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The name(s) associated with the practitioner.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                    <items id="text">Telecom</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A contact detail for the practitioner, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                    <items id="text">Address</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Address(es) of the practitioner that are not role specific (typically home address). 
Work addresses are not typically entered in this property as they are usually role dependent.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                                    <items id="text">Gender</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                                    <items id="text">Male</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is male.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                                    <items id="text">Female</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is female.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                                    <items id="text">Other</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is other.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                                    <items id="text">Unknown</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is unknown.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                                    <items id="text">Birthdate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The date on which the practitioner was born.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                                    <items id="text">Identifier</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Identifier details for the practitioner.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                                    <items id="text">Practitioner role</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The role fulfilled by the practitioner.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>

                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.service.v0</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="text">Service</items>
                                    <items id="description">A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Service planned</items>
                                    <items id="description">Service request to healthcare provider is planned.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">Service scheduled</items>
                                    <items id="description">Appointment for a healthcare provider service has been made.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="text">Service delivered</items>
                                    <items id="description">The healthcare provider has delivered the service.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">Service activity complete</items>
                                    <items id="description">All service activities have been completed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="text">Service abandoned</items>
                                    <items id="description">The referral has been ceased before the service has been completed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                    <items id="text">Service postponed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The planned service has been postponed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="text">Service cancelled</items>
                                    <items id="description">The planned service has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="text">Service suspended</items>
                                    <items id="description">The service has been suspended without completion.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                    <items id="text">Service name</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="text">Reason</items>
                                    <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified service was carried out.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the service.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                    <items id="description">Narrative description about the service, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="text">Service type</items>
                                    <items id="description">Type of service to be carried out or being carried out.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                    <items id="text">Requestor identifier</items>
                                    <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="text">Requestor</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
                                    <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                    <items id="text">Receiver</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                    <items id="text">Sequence</items>
                                    <items id="description">The sequence of the specified clinical service.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service delivered' pathway step. For example: record that this is the 3rd physiotherapy appointment in a planned sequence.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                    <items id="text">Service expired</items>
                                    <items id="description">The referral has expired before the referral episode has been completed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                    <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the service is intended to be performed.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service scheduled' pathway step.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                    <items id="text">Service request sent</items>
                                    <items id="description">Request for service sent.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                    <items id="text">Service detail</items>
                                    <items id="description">Structured information about the service.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about specified aspects of the service.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                    <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                                    <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed service.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>

                                <is_unique>false</is_unique>

                                    <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                                    <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                                    <lower>0</lower>
                                </interval>
                            </cardinality>
                        </attributes>

                                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                                    <items id="text">Name</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Name details aligned with FHIR resource.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                                    <items id="text">Use</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Identification of the purpose for the name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                                    <items id="text">Usual</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The usual name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                                    <items id="text">Official</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The official name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                                    <items id="text">Temp</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A temporary name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                                    <items id="text">Nickname</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A nickname.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                                    <items id="text">Anonymous</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">An anonymous name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                                    <items id="text">Old</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">An old name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                                    <items id="text">Maiden</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The maiden name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                                                    <items id="text">Text</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A text representation of the full name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                                    <items id="text">Family</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Family name or surname.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                                    <items id="text">Given</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Given name, not always first and includes middle name(s).</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                                    <items id="text">Prefix</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                                    <items id="text">Suffix</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                                    <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                                    <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>

                                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                                    <items id="text">Telephone</items>

                                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                                    <items id="text">System</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                                    <items id="text">Telephone number</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                                    <items id="text">Use</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The purpose of the contact point.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                                    <items id="text">Home</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Home contact details.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                                    <items id="text">Work</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Work contact details.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                                    <items id="text">Temp</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Temporary contact details.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                                    <items id="text">Old</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Old contact details.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                                    <items id="text">Mobile</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Mobile contact details.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                                                    <items id="text">Rank</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. Contacts are ranked with lower values coming before higher values.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                                    <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                                    <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                                    <items id="text">Phone</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The communication form is phone.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                                    <items id="text">Fax</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The communication form is fax.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0014">

                                                                </term_definitions>

                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">Status</items>
                                    <items id="description">The current state of the care team.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="text">Proposed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The current status of the care team is proposed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="text">Active</items>
                                    <items id="description">The current status of the care team is active.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                    <items id="text">Suspended</items>
                                    <items id="description">The current status of the care team is suspended.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="text">Inactive</items>
                                    <items id="description">The current status of the care team is inactive.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="text">Entered in error</items>
                                    <items id="description">The current status of the care team is entered in error.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                    <items id="text">Category</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identifies what kind of team. This is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing teams, such as care plan team, episode of care team, longitudinal care team.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="text">Event</items>
                                    <items id="description">The care team category is event.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="text">Encounter</items>
                                    <items id="description">The care team category is encounter.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                    <items id="text">Episode</items>
                                    <items id="description">The care team category is episode.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="text">Longitudinal</items>
                                    <items id="description">The care team category is longitudinal.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                    <items id="text">Condition</items>
                                    <items id="description">The care team category is condition.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="text">Clinical research</items>
                                    <items id="description">The care team category is clinicial research.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="text">Name</items>
                                    <items id="description">A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">E.g. the "red" vs. "green" trauma teams.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                    <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                    <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                    <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                    <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                    <items id="text">Participant</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                    <items id="text">Role</items>
                                    <items id="description">Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                    <items id="text">Member</items>
                                    <items id="description">The specific person or organization who is participating/expected to participate in the care team.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                    <items id="text">On behalf of</items>
                                    <items id="description">The organization of the practitioner.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                    <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                    <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                    <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                    <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                    <items id="text">Reason</items>
                                    <items id="description">Describes why the care team exists.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                    <items id="text">Other details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Comments made about the CareTeam.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                    <items id="text">Managing organisation</items>
                                    <items id="description">The organisation responsible for the care team.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>

                                </interval>
                            </cardinality>

                                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                            <items id="text">Practitioner role</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Practitioner role details aligned with FHIR resource.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                            <items id="text">Identifier</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Identifier details for the practitioner role.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                            <items id="text">Active</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period start</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period end</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                            <items id="text">Practitioner</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organisation.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                            <items id="text">Organisation</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Organisation where the roles are fulfilled.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                            <items id="text">Designation</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Roles which this practitioner may perform.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                            <items id="text">Clinician specialty</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Specific specialty or specialties of the practitioner.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                                            <items id="text">Location</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                            <items id="text">Healthcare service</items>
                                                            <items id="description">The list of healthcare services that this worker provides for this role's Organization/Location(s).</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                            <items id="text">Telecom</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Contact details that are specific to the role/location/service.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>

                                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">

                                                            <items id="description">Family name or surname.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                            <items id="text">Given</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Given name, not always first and includes middle name(s).</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                            <items id="text">Prefix</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                            <items id="text">Suffix</items>
                                                            <items id="description">Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                            <items id="text">Valid period start</items>

                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                        <term_definitions code="at0015">

The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.</items>
                                                        </term_definitions>

                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Responsible clinician</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Practitioner details aligned with FHIR resource.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                    <items id="text">Active</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                                    <items id="text">Name</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The name(s) associated with the practitioner.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                    <items id="text">Telecom</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A contact detail for the practitioner, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                    <items id="text">Address</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Address(es) of the practitioner that are not role specific (typically home address). 
Work addresses are not typically entered in this property as they are usually role dependent.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                                    <items id="text">Gender</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                                    <items id="text">Male</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is male.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                                    <items id="text">Female</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is female.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                                    <items id="text">Other</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is other.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                                    <items id="text">Unknown</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The practitioner gender is unknown.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                                    <items id="text">Birthdate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The date on which the practitioner was born.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                                    <items id="text">Identifier</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Identifier details for the practitioner.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                                    <items id="text">Practitioner role</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The role fulfilled by the practitioner.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
